New Records: Gareth Southgate has taken England to a third tournament semi-final under his management.
Key Match Events: Bukayo Saka scored the equalizer for England with a pinpoint strike.
Jordan Pickford made an excellent save from Zeki Amdouni.
Trent Alexander-Arnold converted the winning penalty for England.
Jordan Pickford saved Manuel Akanji's penalty during the shootout.
Breel Embolo scored for Switzerland to make it 1-0.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate's 100th game in charge of England.
Southgate's decision to introduce Cole Palmer, Eberechi Eze, and Luke Shaw with 12 minutes left.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate praised for his man-management skills.
Southgate's faith in Bukayo Saka allowed him to have his moment of catharsis from the penalty spot.
Southgate hugged his backroom staff and tried to make sense of the victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England will need to be better against the Netherlands in the semi-finals.
England's tactics were neutralizing not only the Swiss but also their own key players like Bellingham, Foden, and Kane.
England equalized with their first shot on target for the second consecutive game.
